title: From gaol to gentry
creator_contributor_role: Australian Institute of Multicultural Affairs, production company
subject_group: Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Wool industry - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Australia - Emigration and immigration
description: Episode number 1 of Series "Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788". This film examines the period of Australian history covering 1788-1840. Depicts the struggle for survival of the first fleet; the transformation of the penal colony into a mecca for British free settlers with the advent of the wool industry; encroachment of the pastoral industry on Aboriginal communities with disastrous results and slowing of migration with economic slump of the 1840's. Suitable for middle to upper secondary levels.
